covered in frost (= the thin, white layer of ice that forms when the air temperature is below the freezing point of water, especially outside at night): I love those last days of autumn with the rimy hedgerows and pale sunlight. The writer conjures up the world of rimy mornings on the marshland extremely vividly.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the rimy dawn, I could see the sheep gathered next to the field wall.The dogs chased the rabbit into a rimy wood.She woke to another rimy day.
